page.title: 02Description of Area(2).
page.content: The position of this area is West-North West of Dorchester. The region is mainly hilly, and is used for farming. It is 12Km square, and contains many wooded plantations. The area is mainly occupied by small farms and parts of the vliiages of Bradford Peverell and Charminster. It also contains part of the town of Dorchester, the county town of Dorset. The North-east corner of this area contains a section of the River Frome, which flows South-East in a valley. The communications include two main roads, the A35 & A37, a railway line, which goes to Bristol, many minor roads serve this area also. Contained in the area there are many historical remains, including Tumuli, Roman roads,and Roman Aqeducts.
